issue.title: SIDH MSR p503 leaks
issue.body:
SIDH MSR p503 and SIDH MSR p503 (params=null) leak memory, caught by valgrind:

```
Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==90716==    at 0x10023796B: __vfprintf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x10025F7FE: __v2printf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x10025FAD0: __xvprintf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x1002359C1: vfprintf_l (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x100233827: printf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x100002B8D: OQS_print_part_hex_string (common.c:45)
==90716==    by 0x10000286C: kex_test_correctness (test_kex.c:99)
==90716==    by 0x1000018C3: main (test_kex.c:172)
==90716==
==90716== Use of uninitialised value of size 8
==90716==    at 0x10023A3BD: __ultoa (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x1002379AE: __vfprintf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x10025F7FE: __v2printf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x10025FAD0: __xvprintf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x1002359C1: vfprintf_l (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x100233827: printf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x100002B8D: OQS_print_part_hex_string (common.c:45)
==90716==    by 0x10000286C: kex_test_correctness (test_kex.c:99)
==90716==    by 0x1000018C3: main (test_kex.c:172)
==90716==
==90716== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==90716==    at 0x10023A3CB: __ultoa (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x1002379AE: __vfprintf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x10025F7FE: __v2printf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x10025FAD0: __xvprintf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x1002359C1: vfprintf_l (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x100233827: printf (in /usr/lib/system/libsystem_c.dylib)
==90716==    by 0x100002B8D: OQS_print_part_hex_string (common.c:45)
==90716==    by 0x10000286C: kex_test_correctness (test_kex.c:99)
==90716==    by 0x1000018C3: main (test_kex.c:172)
```

comment.body: Fixed in PR #230. Valgrind seems to be confused by the subsequent initialization of these values, behind a if statement (branch between SIDH vs. SIKE). I changed the mem alloc to calloc.
